modules.description: Provides DNS client operations including connecting to nameservers, sending and receiving DNS queries, and managing connections with timeouts. Works with DNS protocols, network addresses, and Lwt-based asynchronous I/O structures. Used to establish reliable DNS communication, generate random values for query IDs, and manage timing and resource cleanup in networked applications.

Provides functions to manage UDP communication, including listening for packets on specific ports, handling incoming datagrams, and sending data with optional source addresses and TTL. Operates on IP addresses, port numbers, and Cstruct buffers. Used to establish and manage UDP connections, process incoming traffic, and send packets with controlled network parameters.

This module offers low-level control over TCP connections, enabling operations like establishing links, transmitting data, managing shutdowns, and handling errors during network communication. It interacts with network flows, IP addresses, and custom error types to facilitate reliable data exchange. Use cases include implementing network servers, client protocols, or custom transport layers requiring precise flow management.

Provides pretty-printers for errors, IP addresses, and prefixes. Handles IP layer operations such as demultiplexing incoming packets, sending data with configurable options, and generating pseudoheaders for checksums. Works with IP addresses, prefixes, and network interfaces, supporting tasks like packet routing and MTU management.

Provides functions to create and manage network connection instances with customizable timeouts and resolvers. It supports connecting to hosts or IP addresses, resolving domain names, and injecting custom DNS resolvers. Works with IP addresses, port lists, and DNS resolution functions to establish TCP flows.

Provides functions to construct and manage network protocols using dynamic configurations, including TLS upgrades and protocol handshakes. Works with protocol-specific data structures like connection states, message buffers, and cryptographic parameters. Used to implement custom transport layers in projects requiring low-level network control, such as secure shell implementations or HTTP proxies.

Provides functions to resolve domain names and establish TCP connections with timeout and retry controls. Operates on IP addresses, port lists, and network flows. Used to connect to servers by resolving hostnames and attempting connections in a way that prioritizes faster responses.
